document_title: Rupture of blood vessels in the brain: Signs, causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: vo-mach-mau-nao.json_1_Signs of ruptured cerebral blood vessels
subsection_content:
To identify a patient with a ruptured cerebral aneurysm, you can rely on the following signs: (2)
The headache appears suddenly and is severe, and does not improve despite the use of painkillers; Convulsions of limbs appear; Weakness in all four limbs, even paralysis of half the body; Numbness of limbs; Stiff neck and nape; Nausea, vomiting; Decreased vision, eyes more sensitive to light, blurred vision or double vision; Difficulty speaking, language disorders; Difficulty swallowing; Lightheadedness, dizziness and loss of balance; Loss of consciousness, confusion, coma; Dead
The symptoms of a cerebral blood vessel rupture are almost similar to the symptoms of a patient having a stroke because a cerebral blood vessel rupture is one of the causes of stroke.
People with a ruptured brain aneurysm may have sudden and severe headaches
subsection_title: vo mach mau nao.json. Signs of ruptured cerebral blood vessels
subsection_data:
